Fields.DialogueText: All hands to battlestations!
@BATTLE
We've come a long way from our Mediterranean patrols. Given the work we've done in the Red Sea, nobody's complaining too strenuously, but...
It was worth it to make sure Tetesfewe was seaworthy again.
She isn't exactly what she used to be.
Part of her still lives on, in a way. I couldn't turn my back.
You had to protect a friend. It's an admirable quality, Espero.
And yet, Command is probably less than pleased with us, Tesoro.
The journey did end up taking more time than I anticipated.
You risked your command to indulge me.

Fields.MenuText: It was worth it. Fighting for friends means taking risks.
I'm still not sure it was worth it.
If you're so grateful, how do you plan to make it up to me?

Fields.DialogueText: Sì. It does.
You have to trust that it was.
Let's not get ahead of ourselves, Tesoro.
Eritrea has a fighting chance now, but I know it was costly for you.
I can handle myself.
Well, enough of this. I need a cigarette. Oh, and let's set a course back to the Suez.
The canal? Is it time?
Sì. It's too quiet out here for a girl like me.
To hell and back.
Getting some fresh air?
Little chance of that here. Give me your lighter so I can light my cigarette.
As long as I get that lighter back.
Of course.
...I wonder, Tesoro, am I conspicuous out here?

Fields.MenuText: You know the answer to that. I still catch some of the crew stealing glances at our glamorous Belle.
If you're asking whether the ship looks like a worn-out relic from the old world, my answer is a polite "maybe."
We stand out like we always do. Ready for anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Hardly what I meant, Tesoro, but I appreciate that.
Ouch!
I'm not so sure. We look a bit worse for wear after so much time out here.
The sandstorms have taken a toll on my looks.
I'll have the crew get to work. A touch of paint could go a long way.
I was hoping you'd do that for me.
No problem. Besides, the crew needs something to do to keep them from getting restless.
I know a better cure for that. Maybe a raid would perk them up.
Why do I get the feeling you know something I don't?
Only because I looked off the port bow before you did.
Incoming Morganas...all hands to battle stations!
@BATTLE
No love for the fishermen? That's the third trawler you almost ran over and wrecked.
We maneuvered to avoid a collision in plenty of time. You complain too much.

Fields.MenuText: Slow it down. We're not killing any civilians on my watch.
A warship always has the right of way. The fishing boats will understand.
Who knew that terrorizing local fishing boats could be so fun?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm built for speed. One of my finer qualities, Tesoro, in case you hadn't noticed.
You remembered the war? You'll make a great capitano someday.
Very funny. I save terror for my enemies, Tesoro.
Keep it under control, Espero.
Calling me a bad sailor?
Not exactly, just a dangerous one.
You've never learned how to pay a woman a compliment, have you?
@BATTLE
What is it, mio Tesoro? You should know that I just started smoking a cigarette.
I'm more concerned about how much fuel we're smoking.
We will make it to our destination.
I don't want to end up adrift in the Red Sea.
I said that we will make it. Trust me.

Fields.MenuText: Why are you running so fast to the canal?
What are you afraid of out here?
Steal something from the local police?

Fields.DialogueText: Would you rather be an easy prize for the Morganas?
Afraid? You misunderstand.
Of course not! Well, actually...
These waters are crawling with Morganas. Those Cattive Ragazze will pounce on us if we don't move with a purpose.
Discussing that "purpose" is something we haven't quite gotten around to yet, Espero.
The time isn't right. Let's get through the canal first.
Well, I approve of the direction we're going, and you've earned the benefit of the doubt... for now.
Merda! Here they come. You shouldn't have distracted me.
Don't blame me. It was probably all the angry fishermen...
Silenzio!
@BATTLE
Old habits, eh?
Let's change the subject.
Time to talk, Espero.
After I finish my cigarette.
You can talk and smoke at the same time.
Don't distract me.
You've done a great job evading Morganas, but you won't get away from me so easily.
Shh! Time to focus. We'll be at the entrance to the canal soon.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not taking us into that canal until you talk.
You can trust me. What's the big hurry?
Come to think of it, you are pretty boring conversation.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine!
*sigh*
All right! Enough!
I need us to hurry back to Alexandria. We're running out of time.
Better, but not good enough. Spit it out, Espero.
I have a contact waiting for us there. They're holding something valuable for me. For us.
War profiteering isn't on the menu for this ship.
It isn't like that at all. Trust me.
Get this out of your head and get some rest. I need you ready for the war.
*ALARM*
The war is ready for us right now.
Damn! This conversation isn't finished, Espero.
I know.
@BATTLE
Morgana patrol, coming up at midship!
@BATTLE
Got you where I want you.
How dramatic, Tesoro.
We're slow and steady in the Suez Canal. Plenty of time for us to talk while we transit.
We could talk after we get through? We're vulnerable here, and I have to pay attention.
Our lookouts are doing their jobs. Focus on me.
Fine.
Now, about this mad dash to Alexandria...
My contact there is waiting for us with a package. We don't have much time.
Your contact? What's he holding?
She is going to sell us something. Something important.

Fields.MenuText: As your captain, I deserve to know everything you're up to.
Good enough for me. Say no more. I'm in.
"Important." Gee. How informative. So helpful.

Fields.DialogueText: Direct as ever. I suppose you are right.
Why give up so easily now? I was just starting to respect your persistence.
Sarcasm doesn't become you.
A priceless scroll from the Ancient Library of Alexandria, hundreds of years old, has recently become... available.
Even for you, making money off stolen relics is low.
That's not my goal, Tesoro. You should know me better.
Well, you do like to borrow things–permanently–without permission.
I do enjoy taking souvenirs, but this is different. This scroll may unlock secrets to an advantage over the Morganas.
No tricks? This is real?
I am gambling that it is. That it could be.
I need to think about this, Espero.
Sì, of course, but don't take long. Time is short.
How, exactly? And according to whom?
Whispers from the Vatican, Tesoro. The scroll is thought to have something to do with the "Sea Peoples" who attacked ancient Egypt - and with the civilizational collapse late in the Bronze Age.
Perhaps it has to do with an earlier wave of Morganas, lost to most history. Perhaps it's about a weapon. All I know is that it's a prize.
Almost out of the Suez. Helm, standby for flank speed.
Standing by, Captain.
Wait! Not yet.
You harass me day and night to go faster, faster, faster...but now you want to wait?!
A small problem. The steam turbines can't deliver full propulsion because the condensers can't hold a vacuum.
Damn! Are the seawater intakes clogged?
Precisamente. It's this desert canal. We've sucked up too much sand.
Fix it, Espero. Get me flank speed. Capisci?
Capisco, Capitano. Working on it! Don't fret, Tesoro. I'll have it fixed soon.
Why do you sound so... happy?
Perhaps I'm just glad that you're as excited to hurry to Alexandria as I am.
But I'm not thinking about Alexandria right now.
What?
I'm thinking about those Morganas astern, chasing us down in the canal.
Cattive Ragazze? Merda! We don't have time for this!
Get back to the engine room and get me some speed, Espero!
You'll have it soon... but you have my guns right now.
@BATTLE
Morganas coming up off the starboard bow!
@BATTLE
Espero?
Up here, Tesoro!
Sitting up in the rigging while we cruise at thirty-nine knots? Quite a sight.
Glamorous, sì? I am so happy to be free of that tiny canal and feel the wind again.

Fields.MenuText: Let your hair down to get all the sand out of it.
Get down here so we can talk without shouting.
You can't hide from me up there.

Fields.DialogueText: Buona idea, but I should probably come down to talk to you.
I suppose...
Why must you assume the worst? I was just about to come down to talk to you.
We must speak about meeting my contact in Alexandria.
Getting into that port is going to be impossible.
No, getting into that port is going to be unnecessary. Take this.
A piece of paper? What are these coordinates?
My contact is waiting at that location for us, fifty miles north of the Alexandria port.
I'll set a course for it at top speed.
Grazie, Tesoro.
Let's hope this isn't a trap.
How close are we? Did you ask the Navigator?
It won't be long. And leave the Navigator alone - you've pestered him enough.
I don't understand why he doesn't like me.
You stole his favorite pencil.
Ah, right, I suppose I did.
The crew is starting to get anxious. They know we're in a hurry, but they don't know why.
Don't tell the crew about the scroll or about anything else.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not the kind of captain who lies to their crew.
They're risking their lives, too. Why keep them in the dark?
We can't let details of our mission spread. Keeping them ignorant is the best move.

Fields.DialogueText: You aren't lying to them. You're keeping them safe.
We can't have our plan be discovered by the wrong forces.
It is necessary to keep them in the dark for now.
We have no choice, Tesoro, but to keep this to ourselves. Imagine what would happen if the Cattive Ragazze found out.
I understand. This is tough enough even without racing every Morgana group in the Mediterranean.
Precisamente.
Anything else?
Just one thing. Can you go ask the Navigator how close we are now?
Espero...
@BATTLE
Stop transmitting on that radio! Give me that!
Ma'am? You aren't supposed to unplug the radio.
Oh, really? I am your Belle! Stop transmitting and disconnect that radio at once!
What's all this shouting in the radio room?
Why is everybody fighting in here?
Captain...
Dismissed.
Yes, Captain.
That radio operator would not obey his Belle.

Fields.MenuText: You owe him an apology. He was doing his job.
He should listen to his Belle.
You could have at least told him why.

Fields.DialogueText: His job is to follow his orders, but he refused mine!
Precisamente, Tesoro.
And jeopardize the mission?
It sounds like you were trying to pull the plug on the radio. Trying to maintain radio silence?
Sì. We are close to my contact, and I don't want any attention drawn to us.
Understood, but next time, figure out how to do that without starting a fight with the crew.
*ALARM*
Merda! I may have been too late. Sink that Morgana before she gives us away.
@BATTLE
At long last. We're at the coordinates.
Small vessel approaching! No flag or markings, just two black pennants on the mast.
Looks like a smuggler. Ready the guns for a warning shot.
Don't shoot! Let that boat come closer.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, Espero. I was keeping up appearances for the crew.
Are you certain that's your contact with the scroll?
I'm keeping the guns ready.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that, Tesoro.
See those two black pennants on the mast? That's her.
Go ahead, but you won't need them.
Now the smuggler boat has turned around. It's heading away!
That boat was getting closer... but now she's leaving?
Look in the water. See that crate?
Ah. She jettisoned that before she turned to go.
That must be our scroll. Bring it aboard!
Lookout, send a team to recover that crate.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Hurry!
Relax. We finally have what we came for.
We aren't the only ones. Were we followed here?
Morganas approaching from all sides, Captain!
It's a damn ambush. What did you get us into, Espero?
I swear I had nothing to do with them turning up!
@BATTLE
Morganas dead ahead!
@BATTLE
Capitano. Come inside and lock the door.
All right. It's just the two of us in here. Is that the crate?
What other crate did we almost die recovering? Yes, of course this is the crate.
Forget I asked.
Help me pry this open.

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope this isn't booby trapped.
Allow me.
It's your crate. Open it yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Perish the thought, Tesoro.
É una cosa genial di te.
Fine. This Belle is not afraid to get her hands dirty.
One...two...three! There.
There, at the bottom, in that leather case.
Be careful handling that. If it's as old as they say, it will be brittle.
I'm unrolling it now.
It's...blank? I'm not impressed, Espero.
Give me that. It's not blank. It's...faint. I see writing on it, but I am not sure what language it is.
Take your time and figure it out.
Aye aye, Tesoro.
This better be worth it.
I'm well aware of that.
Finally coming out of your quarters? You were in there a long time.
I've studied the scroll carefully. It's...strange.
How so?
It's a recipe for soup.
You're kidding me.
Not exactly. Do you know what a palimpsest is?

Fields.MenuText: No, but it sounds delicious. What's in it?
Sure. It's a fancy box with long horizontal poles for royalty to ride in. The workers carry it around on their shoulders.
Yes. It's recycled parchment.

Fields.DialogueText: A palimpsest is not soup, my foolish Tesoro.
No, no, no. That's a palanquin. A palimpsest is something else.
Ah, you are more of a scholar than I guessed, Tesoro.
Our scroll is a palimpsest, meaning that the original writing was scraped off so that the parchment could be re-used.
Somebody wiped out ancient wisdom and secrets to make room for a soup recipe? Great.
The original writing wasn't completely erased. It's just faint and hard to read.
Hidden layers. All right, keep working on it.
I will. Try to keep things quiet so I can concentrate.
I'll make sure you aren't disturbed. Get back to work.
I wonder if—
*ALARM*
AGHHH!
@BATTLE
Enemy patrol sighted!
@BATTLE
Move aside, please. I need to get into the radio room.
That's not a great idea. You threw a fit in there last time.
Did you forget? I apologized to that crewman, Tesoro.
Tell me why you want to go in there.
I'm going to radio Headquarters and make a request.
About the scroll?
I need a translator. The writing on the scroll is in ancient Greek, and I can't translate it myself.

Fields.MenuText: It's risky to talk about this ancient scroll over the radio.
Maybe we have somebody on board who can read it.
Do it. It's worth taking a chance.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't have any other options.
I have already asked around. No one can.
I'll be discreet.
Go for it. We've invested a lot in this scroll, and I mean to see just what it can do for the war effort.
What is it?
Non importa. I'll let you know when I'm done.
Nice of you to join me, mio Tesoro.
It's beautiful up here.
The Mediterranean has its charms, sì.
And it's nice to not be running all the time.
This is only the calm before the storm, I fear.
Fear? That's a new one for you.
I am concerned about the reply from Command.
You radioed your request for a translator?
I did. The response was unsettling.
What did they say?
Nothing. They told me to wait.

Fields.MenuText: It's your imagination. Everything will work out fine.
You're right to be worried. Command might say that we're crazy and call us back to port.
You think that's a bad reaction?

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you are right. Thank you for trying to reassure me.
That would be terrible. All of that effort for nothing.
They hardly reacted at all! For something this important, that troubles me.
All we can do now is wait for an answer.
Sì. I suppose that means it's time for a cigarette.
*ALARM*
Merda.
Is it just me, or are these Morgana attacks getting more frequent?
My guns worry about one fight at a time.
@BATTLE
Still waiting?
Yes, damn it all. Still no answer from Command.
They're busy fighting the war, I suppose.
I keep thinking about it, too. And what comes after. What will happen to us?
You mean after the fighting stops?
Precisamente. What do we become after that?

Fields.MenuText: We'll find something better to do than chase Morganas all day long.
Maybe we'll end up like palimpsest parchments. Scraped clean and used for something else.
We'll be the same. No matter what, you'll be my Belle and I'll be your Tesoro.

Fields.DialogueText: You make it sound so simple.
More like scrapped. Like Tetesfewe.
How sentimental of you.
We've been through a lot together so far.
We aren't done yet.
*ALARM*
Not by a long shot.
@BATTLE
Or a great new recipe for soup.
Haha! Grazie, Tesoro. I needed a laugh.
Morgana flotilla ahead!
@BATTLE
I heard you were on the radio with Command.
Take a seat, Espero. Put these headphones on.
Do they have a translator?
They told me to standby. You didn't miss anything yet.
Good.
*static* Captain, this is Command. You have new orders. Proceed west to your new coordinates.
Roger, Command. Is this my rendezvous for picking up a translator?
Negative. Proceed to your new coordinates and resume combat patrol operations.
Merda! I've heard enough.
What was that? Say again, over.
Command, we cannot hear you. Please repeat your message.
I say again, proceed to—
*CLICK*
*STATIC*
Did you just hang up on Command? I didn't receive the new coordinates yet.
Sì. We cannot follow that order.

Fields.MenuText: Trust them. Command can work on translating the scroll while we get back to the fight.
Do you want me to end up in front of a firing squad?
You're right. We can't abandon this now.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you see? They're not going to translate it for us. They think we're crazy.
Do you want to end up in front of Morgana guns forever? This is about defeating them for good!
Thank you for trusting me, Tesoro.
You better have a good plan, Espero.
I do. Plot a course for Athens.
Athens?
I will explain on the way.
You think we'll find a translator in Athens?
That's the best place to find someone who can read the ancient Greek writing on that scroll.
It's a safe bet.
Athens was home to ancient libraries, too. In fact, Aristotle's library was in Athens before the contents were relocated to Alexandria.
Yes, but—
But what?

Fields.MenuText: We're generating a lot of attention.
Never mind. We need to know what that scroll says.
I think I left my library card at home.

Fields.DialogueText: We tried to be discreet.
Agreed.
I never understood library cards. I just take the books I want.
With the Morganas and now Command looking for us, this mission won't be secret much longer.
Then it's a good thing I'm fast.
All ahead flank!
@BATTLE
Damn! I never expected the Aegean would be teeming with Morgana patrols.
The Cattive Ragazze are everywhere.
Give me one of those cigarettes while I think about this.
Here. I will light it for you.
What are they all doing out here?
Waiting for us.

Fields.MenuText: We could try to slip through at night.
We could go in guns blazing.
We could look for a weak spot in the patrol.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think it makes a difference to the Morganas.
I'm not afraid of a straight fight, but our odds would be slim.
I agree. We should use the islands as cover.
Then we'll cut across behind one of these islands. Set a course for Serifos.
At once, but we will have to cross that small Morgana convoy first.
Let's make this quick.
@BATTLE
I don't get it. These Morgana patrols get worse and worse.
They do.
The more I try to get around them, the tighter they box us in.
It's... uncanny.
I hope that scroll is worth it.
It will be. I am confident it will lead to an advantage over the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: I'll bet it has information on something that can permanently hurt them, like Greek fire.
I wonder if it will have information about where the Morganas came from.
Honestly, I'm having difficulty imagining how a dusty scroll is going to help us right now.

Fields.DialogueText: The recipe for Greek fire has been lost for over a millennium. Who can say?
A foul pit somewhere, as far as I'm concerned. I'd rather know how to kill them.
Let's just concentrate on getting to Athens.
Our answers will come later. Right now, we have a patrol to fend off.
Those answers can't come soon enough.
@BATTLE
Another cup of coffee?
Thanks. Do I look tired?
Esausto, Tesoro.
The Morganas haven't given us a break. These patrols are relentless.
We're crawling closer to Athens with each step.
When we get behind Makronisos, we should be able to hide behind the island and catch our breath.
Agreed. The island will cover us.
I thought the Morganas were all coming here for some other reason, but now I think they were expecting us to show up.
You think somebody told them?
I know somebody did.

Fields.MenuText: They've intercepted the radio transmissions.
Somebody on the crew talked.
That smuggler friend of yours gave us up.

Fields.DialogueText: That was a risk we had to take.
È impossibile. They're loyal.
È impossibile. If she meant to betray us, why would she give us the scroll?
... It was me. This was always the plan. I wanted the Morganas to follow us here.
No. Stop. We need to deal with the current crisis - and *then* I'll figure out whether trusting you was so stupid I need to resign my commission.
I can explain! Just give me a moment!
*ALARM*
We don't have one! Morganas coming in from both sides. What have you done to us?!
@BATTLE
... I'm waiting for the punchline.
Tesoro...
More Morganas...
@BATTLE
These patrols keep driving us back. Soon we'll have the whole Morgana fleet on top of us.
Tesoro, we have to talk.
If I could lock you in the brig right now, I would. You'd just walk through the walls, though.
Please, let me explain.
You get one chance. Make it good.
I didn't betray us to the Morganas.
Oh, I didn't think you did. I just think you took advantage of my trust and put my crew at unreasonable risk for reasons you didn't bother to disclose.
Command needed a ship for a dangerous mission, a suicide mission. You never heard about it because... I hid it from you.
... I'm going to need you to repeat that so I'm sure I heard you correctly.
It was Command's decision, Tesoro - but I supported it. It needed to be obvious that you were doing everything in your power to complete the cover mission.
Keep talking.
Command needed us to pull as many Morganas as I could away from Gibraltar. The Morgana fleet was blocking the strait.
That still doesn't explain why all the earlier theatrics were necessary.
We couldn't lure so many Morganas that far without something convincing. A shady smuggler, starting rumors with the crew, desperate radio calls to Command...
All to fool the Morganas.
The only way to be sure.
And that scroll?
Is just an old scroll. Not a recipe for a super-weapon. It might really be a soup recipe for all I know.
MacGuffin Stew. Was it worth it?
We're the ones responsible for pulling the Morganas away... and letting a massive fleet movement into the Mediterranean.
Reinforcements are coming?
Not reinforcements. A strike force. An armada to crush the Morganas here in the Aegean.
We're almost done. Trust me one more time and set a course south for Crete.
To be bait one last time. So be it.
You realize this was probably meant as a message, right? Somebody in Command - probably Italian - is showing displeasure over the Tetesfewe situation.
Using us as bait? Trying to put a wedge between us? The thought did occur to me.
I just don't know if it's still going to get worse from here.
But, still... the plan is working. That has to be what matters most, doesn't it?
Those Morgana shells are landing too close for comfort, Espero!
I am running at flank speed, Tesoro. Trust that the armada will be here soon.
Hopefully they haven't figured out the scroll is a fake.
It took you long enough, so maybe we still have a chance.

Fields.MenuText: Don't make jokes about that so soon.
That armada better not be another lie.
Yeah, but they may not have trusted you the way I did.

Fields.DialogueText: Mi dispiace, Tesoro. It was just some gallows humor.
I swear I would have told you sooner if I could have. I had to be convincing!
I understand you are still angry with me, Tesoro. But, please, believe in me now.
If the Morganas still think we have an ancient scroll that can make a superweapon, they'll chase us with everything they've got.
That's what I'm counting on.
I'm counting on that armada showing up, or we're goners.
They'll be here. Just keep fighting!
@BATTLE
That's it. Our engines will be running on fumes soon.
So close. We almost made it.
No sign of that armada yet?
Sadly, no.

Fields.MenuText: It was worth it. Even though we'll die here, maybe we still bought them some time.
We gave it our best.
I should have realized this sooner.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't give up yet!
There they are! Coming from the west!
Yes! Allied ships! So many of them coming over the horizon...
We might still die in this fight, but we completed our mission. This should be a slaughter.
Can you drive on fumes?
Even if my engines stop, my guns will keep firing until the end.
@BATTLE
Capitano?
Come in. The doctor said I could have visitors.
Ah, mio Tesoro, you look...well.
You don't have to pull punches. I know I look rough, but I'll recover. Are you all right?
Asking about me? Yes, this ship will recover, too.
Glad to hear it, Espero.
I'm sorry for underestimating you. When I asked you to meet that smuggler, you did it. Try to infiltrate Athens? You did it.
I trusted all of your crazy plans.
You sensed the truth. You were willing to risk your career and your life for a greater good. I was the one who just followed orders... and didn't trust you enough.
What do we do now?
I kept a secret from you when I had no right. I am a Belle, so I can't leave, but if you want to transfer to another ship, I would understand.
No.
No?
I went along with your crazy ideas because I knew you were doing what you did for the greater good - and I was right. You may have bruised my ego, but you didn't betray my trust.
Mio Tesoro! You have no idea how glad I am to hear it. I am forever your dedicated ally and friend.
Do me two favors, though?
Anything.
Throw that scroll overboard and get me a bowl of soup.
Anything for my friend!
Command may be a whole other matter. But you and I are okay.
